body.name: Dark State (Jason Trapp Thriller Book 1)
body.description: If you come after the CIA’s most feared assassin, there’s one cardinal rule: Don’t miss.America is under attack. Thousands lie dead after simultaneous strikes across the country. The day will come to be known as Bloody Monday.Jason Trapp, codename ‘Hangman’, was a covert operative whose feats became the stuff of legend. He was the tip of the spear—the man his country unleashed when all hope was lost.Six months ago, someone sold him out. The Agency listed him as killed in action. He lost everything—and everyone—he held dear.But Trapp’s not that easy to kill. As his country reels from the deadliest terrorist attacks it has ever witnessed, Trapp’s personal vendetta leads him right back to where he started: duty to his country. The violence, the terror, the assassination of his partner… It’s all connected.And now the Hangman is coming for the guilty.⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯"Fans of Ryan, Reacher and Bourne will love betrayed CIA operative Jason Trapp, who stars in a pulse-pounding revenge thriller in 2019's breakout hit."Note: Dark State was previously published as Deep State.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars if you like non-stop action this book is for you
reviews.reviewText: The action starts on the first page and never stops. I have to warn you that a major conspiracy occurs that threatens the United States an it is so real that it will put a burn in your stomach. The bad guys are unbeatable and it will make you think that this could happen and we could end up like the poor folks attacked or be forced to live in a place with no freedom. That’s all I’m saying, you will have to read the book to see ….

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Actually, 4 1/2 stars-impressive thriller
reviews.reviewText: This was a great read! What starts as a disastrous train takeover by terrorists in Colorado turns into a mind numbing & well written conspiracy plot to undermine the USA. Jason Trapp is the former & presumed dead CIA undercover operative who literally gets sucked into the middle of it all. So many levels of plot twists & turns reminiscent of a great Clancy or Child novel. I took the bait & am hooked on reading the whole series. Love it when I find a new superhero to spend time with!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked all the main characters and I hope I see them again in future books. I think the author revealed the bad guy too soon but it did not ruin the book. Lots of action that kept me turning the pages. I read the book in two days. kudos

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Jack Slater has written an engrossing novel about what is conceivable with today's technology for the future of the US, and the world. Terrifying, intense, intriguing, and above all, a warning to us all. Prejudice has no place in today's educated world, yet it seems to be a virus spreading uncontrolled outside the petri dish from where it was fed by hatred.I don't recommend this book to those prone to nightmares. But, it's a really good read!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good read. Maybe 10% more characters development.Very nice first book. Can’t wait for number two !Action sequences very well written

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved every second of this book riveting, scary, and very cool. I'm going to start the next one. Have to wait till tomorrow to start, or I will be up all night.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Writer, Flawed Story
reviews.reviewText: Jack Slater is a good writer, but he could have benefited from some solid editing. The characters were engaging and well formed and Slater's writing style is crisp and skillful. I'd certainly give another one in the series a try.Here's the problem there were occasions in the story where there were serious disconnects. For example, early in the story (so as not to give away too much) he rushes into an active shooter situation unarmed and goes to a lot of trouble to get a handgun off an dead cop. Yet only a few pages before he had his own gun tucked into his waistband. Similar disconnects occur throughout the story. There are times when someone he's working with is prescient with no plausible explanation of how they acquired the information. The story line goes to great lengths to show the impossibility of getting that type of information due to a third party controlling and corrupting intelligence information. Our hero is supposed to be in the dark, yet he's not in the dark. Furthermore, he turns up when something is about to happen, thwarts it and doesn't even consider the possibility that they might try again. The person Jason Trapp saves is left alone and unprotected the next afternoon. Doesn't compute. If he tightens up his stories and clears up contradictions in the plot, his writing style and interesting characters should make him an author to read over and over again. Since there are already many books in the series, he's either done it by now or not. If he hasn't, I'll attempt to read one more and give up.I could be wrong, but I suspect a lot of ebook writers don't simulateously work with a reputable publishing company that offer the kind of help this book could have used and it may seem too tedious to reread your work several times to pick up on plot flaws. I've reread this review and bet I've missed errors, so it happens and everything written could benefit from an impartial review by experienced eyes. Thankfully, ebook writers who don't use publishing house editors do tend to improve in subsequent books. I hope Jack Slater has done that because he has one quality that only a few really good writers have. He has the ability to get you sucked into the story from the very beginning. I am often amazed how a large percentage of authors can't create a "page turner" from the first chapter. Only previous readers through reviews or word of mouth make you plod onward past dull openings in many books. There are so many books and so little time, I want to be engaged from the first chapter, if not the first page. On that, Slater gets 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a can’t stop reading book. The characters are intense. The story involves the safety of all Americans, politics, traitors and hero’s.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Move over Jack Reacher, Jason Trapp has arrived
reviews.reviewText: This book grips you from the first chapter, a complete surprise as I selected this book randomly. My kind of book and now moving swiftly onto Trapps next adventure in False Flag.

in eine beklemmende brutale Story, die darker kaum sein kann. Ein Plot, der ein Land an und über den Abgrund bringt und mittendrin - Jason Trapp. Vor six month für KIA im Yemen erklärt und seitdem off grid, wird er smack dab in die blutigen Ereignisse waterboarded. In Boston wird er zum Hero als er ein weiteres Massaker verhindert. Sein Team aus hunted CIA operatives und dem Deputy Director/ CIA Mitchell, den er für den Tod seines Freundes und Partners Ryan Price verantwortlich macht, es aber nicht ist wie es sich herausstellt, der special activity division und former Trapp's Boss, Kyle einem IT Nerd der NSA und Perkins und Winks. dazu gesellt sich Special Agent Nadine "Dani" Carter, finden sich in eine Welt geworfen, die brualer und grausamer und rücksichtsloser nicht sein kann. Ein Land fällt in sich zusammen, die NSA hacked, FBI und law enforcement kompromitiert, Nash ein neuer rookie President im Office und eine conspiracy, die genau dort hin strebt. Whoa!Klasse. Fast- paced action mit einem sehr sympathischen American Hero, der nicht nur fun, die scene am Ende im OO - herrlich!, sondern direkte unmittelbare action verspricht - und hält. Mehr als hält.Es hat richtig Spaß gemacht mit Jasaon Trapp die Welt zu retten und ich freue mich riesig auf das zweite book "False Flag."
Just finish reading all the books, to date, of the series.Great reads on in all.Awaiting more, so get to it Jack.

Slater mixes the current political crisis and uses political science scenarios that are chilling to the bone as his narration is extremely plausible. Lived in DC, and know Utah so all of that is close to home.
It's been long since I have read something like this, pretty good, not too much of Macho stuff and unbelievable stuff. Good one will be looking forward for more similar reads
